turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm thinking about participating in a hackathon, but I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed. I've never done one before. Any tips on where to start?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hi there! Hackathons can be exciting! My first suggestion is to determine what kind of hackathon you want to participate in. Are you interested in a specific technology, like AI or blockchain? Or a specific problem domain, like healthcare or education? Narrowing your focus will make it easier to find a relevant event and choose a project.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that makes sense. I'm leaning towards something AI-related, since I've been playing around with some machine learning libraries lately. But how do I even *find* a good hackathon? And what if I don't have a team?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Great choice! To find AI-focused hackathons, you can check websites like Devpost, Major League Hacking (MLH), and Eventbrite. Many universities and companies also host them. As for teams, most hackathons have a team-formation component at the beginning. You can pitch your skills and ideas and find others with complementary skills. Don't worry if you're solo; it's a common starting point. Good luck!
